## The Connection Between Inflammation and PCOS: A Comprehensive FAQ

Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) is a common hormonal disorder affecting women of reproductive age. Characterized by irregular periods, high levels of androgens (male hormones), and cysts in the ovaries, PCOS can lead to a variety of health issues, including infertility, insulin resistance, and weight gain. One lesser-known aspect of PCOS is its link to chronic inflammation. In this article, we'll explore the connection between inflammation and PCOS, answering some of the most frequently asked questions on the topic.
